content.raw: Upon further conversation with Ian, we’re going to make this a model plugin so it shouldn’t require updating the models, only the launch configurations.  PR incoming shortly to address this.
content.html: Upon further conversation with Ian, we’re going to make this a model plugin so it shouldn’t require updating the models, only the launch configurations. PR incoming shortly to address this.

content.html: @Alfredo Bencomo @Michael Carroll Please add the gas sensor to all sensor configurations for all models. Cost will remain the same.

content.html: We can add it to the environment, but we need to additionally update the models to have the sensor. I can do that today. Which models will be equipped with the sensor?

content.raw: @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} DARPA is asking if this is ready to go? i.e. place the gas emitter in one of the Service Rooms and the robots able to report the location?
content.html: @Ian Chen DARPA is asking if this is ready to go? i.e. place the gas emitter in one of the Service Rooms and the robots able to report the location?

update.description:
A two part system for subt for defining regions where gas is emitted and may be detected.

Part 1 is the definition of emitters. This is done via a world plugin where multiple bounding cubes may be specified where gases are being emitted. This specification is done through the size of a cube as well as it’s pose \(note that only cubes are supported at this time\)

Part 2 is the detector, which is a sensor plugin. When the detector is within one of these bounding cubes, it will publish a true detection. Detectors may additionally specify types, which will only respond to gasses in the space-separated list. If no type is specified, the detector will respond to all gas types.

‌
update.title: Gas Emitter/Detector Plugin

content.raw: nice, looks good to me. Test also works now with catkin
content.html: nice, looks good to me. Test also works now with catkin

content.raw: Does the `topic` already exist or do we need to add it to the `ros1-ign` package?
content.html: Does the topic already exist or do we need to add it to the ros1-ign package?

content.raw: That is correct.  It is determined by the `topic` field associated with the sensor’s `SDF` description.
content.html: That is correct. It is determined by the topic field associated with the sensor’s SDF description.
